content:
Diagnosis:
Triple negative breast cancer (signet ring carcinoma)
Left breast T1cN1mi(sn)M0, diagnosed March 2024
Androgen receptor positive

Previous Treatment:
Wide local excision and sentinel node biopsy 15 April 2024
Commenced adjuvant dose-dense AC-T chemotherapy 10 May 2024

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg prn
Pegfilgrastim monthly
Metoclopramide 10mg prn

Current situation:
Pre cycle 3 of 4 AC chemotherapy

I was very pleased to see [redacted name] in clinic today who is managing remarkably well with her chemotherapy treatment. She continues to show great resilience and maintains a positive outlook. Her main challenges have been fatigue in the week following treatment and some mild nausea, though this is well controlled with anti-emetics. She has experienced partial hair loss but is coping well with this using a wig provided by our specialist nurse team.

On examination today, her surgical wound has healed beautifully with no concerns. There is no lymphoedema or restricted movement. Her observations are stable and she has maintained her weight at 68kg.

Her blood results show adequate neutrophils at 2.8 and normal liver function. We can therefore proceed with cycle 3 AC as planned today. She will then have her final AC cycle in 2 weeks before moving onto weekly paclitaxel.

The plan is to see her again before cycle 4 AC. I have provided information about the transition to paclitaxel and what to expect. She understands to contact our acute oncology service if she develops any concerning symptoms in the meantime.

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and sentinel node biopsy

patient_facts.value: Fatigue in week following treatment and mild nausea, controlled with anti-emetics
Surgical wound well healed, no lymphoedema or restricted movement

status_updates.value: Early stage triple negative breast cancer, tolerating adjuvant AC chemotherapy well with manageable side effects
Grade 1-2 fatigue, mild nausea, partial alopecia
Proceeding with cycle 3 AC chemotherapy at full dose
Review before cycle 4 AC chemotherapy in 2 weeks
